definition: far/distant/remote/(intensifier in a comparison) by far/much (lower etc)
far/distant/remote/(intensifier in a comparison) by far/much (lower etc)

sentences.english: And in God's house forevermore, my dwelling place shall be.
sentences.chinese: 我必居住在主殿中，直到永永遠遠。

sentences.english: I will always obey your law, for ever and ever.
sentences.chinese: 我要常守你的律法，直到永永遠遠。

sentences.english: And the smoke of their torment rises for ever and ever.
sentences.chinese: 他受痛苦的煙往上冒，直到永永遠遠。

sentences.english: So shall I keep thy law continually for ever and ever.
sentences.chinese: 我要常守你的律法，直到永永遠遠。

sentences.english: I love you, and I hope you always happy.
sentences.chinese: 永永遠遠都不會讓你挨餓受凍的。

sentences.english: And when thro'death to life I've passed, Forevermore I'll sing of Thee.
sentences.chinese: 或經死亡進入永生，永永遠遠我歌頌你。

sentences.english: Now unto God and our Father be glory for ever and ever.
sentences.chinese: 願榮耀歸給我們的父神，直到永永遠遠。

sentences.english: The LORD shall reign for ever and ever.
sentences.chinese: 耶和華必作王，直到永永遠遠。

sentences.english: We shall reign with the Lord forever and ever.
sentences.chinese: 我們要與主作王，直到永永遠遠。

sentences.english: Just like the song goes, "always an heir of the dragon".
sentences.chinese: 就像歌裏唱得一樣，“永永遠遠是龍的傳人。”

definition: virtue has its rewards (idiom); one good turn deserves another
to waste time on worthless activities
to walk hand in hand/to cooperate
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
to pray on behalf of sb
lit. knifes piercing both sides (idiom)/fig. to attach a great importance to friendship, up to the point of being able to sacrifice oneself for it
